intro: Senecillis phaenicochaeta, commonly known as the golden hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its delicate, fine leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces yellowish to golden flowers, which are often adorned with hairy structures, giving it its common name. Senecillis phaenicochaeta thrives in wetland or marshy environments, often forming dense mats on the ground. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland conservation efforts.
